titleInfo.title: Letter, Henry Cherry in Knoxville, Tenn. to Amos Gould in Owosso, Mich., 1865 March 27

mods.abstract: In this letter, dated March 27, 1865, from Henry Cherry in Knoxville, Tenn. to Amos Gould, Cherry recounts the story of the Battle of Fort Sanders. He also describes Knoxville's fortifications as well as his current location across the Holston River from Knoxville, saying he has "a fair and beautiful view of the city & the river between us which is somewhat over 1000 feet wide & in low water from 8 to 12 feet deep in the channel." Further, Cherry tells of a growing uneasiness in the area, as "over 70,000 troops are said to have passed through Knoxville to operate somewhere around Lynchburg."

subject.topic: United States. Army. Michigan Cavalry Regiment, 10th (1861-1865).
